Finally, the Strengthening Whistleblower Protections at the Department of Veterans' Affairs Act provides critical protection for whistleblowers and ensures we can keep our commitments to our servicemembers.
The REMOVE Copays Act prohibits the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) from imposing co-pays for the first three mental health outpatient care visits each year.
The Solid Start Act permanently authorizes and expands the Solid Start program, which helps veterans know the resources available to them in their first year of separation from the military.
The Expanding Home Loans for Guard and Reservists Act expands the eligibility of members of the National Guard for housing loans guaranteed by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.
The Food Security for All Veterans Act creates the Office of Food Security within the Department of Veterans Affairs to study food security issues and take steps to address hunger.
The AUTO for Veterans Act would allow eligible veterans or servicemembers to access an additional automobile under the VA automobile allowance and adaptive equipment program.

The Supporting Families of the Fallen Act will increase the Servicemembers' Group Life Insurance maximum coverage amount to $500,000 to better protect servicemembers‚Äô families and loved ones in the event of their death in the defense of their nation.
